{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3421780,"name":"Gavin","username":"ghiggins","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/a183cd/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T03:18:43.464Z","cooked":"

Will the new radio VH-109 be supplied in the box every team gets at kickoff? My team doesn’t want to drop $180 now, when we don’t even need it, if we could get one for free when we actually need it.

New Radio in KOP? General Forum
Anyone know if FIRST will provide a new radio in the KOP?
","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-08T03:20:40.668Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":450,"readers_count":449,"score":135.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470914,"topic_slug":"do-i-need-to-buy-vh-109","display_username":"alst","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/new-radio-in-kop/470825","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"New Radio in KOP?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25570,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FiM CSA/etc."},"post_url":"/t/do-i-need-to-buy-vh-109/470914/3","custom_user_title":"FiM CSA/etc.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3421898,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T20:37:56.001Z","cooked":"

You’ll get one in the KOP but you probably need at least 2 so that you can practice with one set up as a base station and one on the robot. There’s a million warnings about trying to use it in 2.4GHz mode with just a single access point in the robot, though it does work (with some occasional dropouts). You can always practice with the old radio and just use the new one for comps? But it’s maybe better to use the new one where you can for consistency.

It’s not clear if you would need 4 radios to practice with 2 robots.

I’m aware of the proliferation of 2.4 ghz and phones. But that has never prevented us from being able to use 2.4 in a build location. I was just wondering if there was something about the new radio that made the performance better/worse.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-08T23:58:10.631Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470914,"topic_slug":"do-i-need-to-buy-vh-109","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/do-i-need-to-buy-vh-109/470914/5","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3421918,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T22:54:55.171Z","cooked":"

I presume you are confused by the “There’s a million warnings about trying to use it in 2.4GHz mode…”

2.4GHz is a common band that a great many wireless deivces use.

If you are in a space where wifi is broadcasting, people are using bluetooth headphones, someone is on a wireless landline phone, and worse yet someone fires up a microwave to warm up that frozen burrito - your robot-driverstation connection will be competing with all these other devices for bandwidth in the 2.4GHz spectrum and it would not be uncommon to experience a dropout, or a stuttering robot due to periodic connection or bandwidth issues.

Using 1 of the new VH-109 radios on your robot and one at your driver station allows you to use the 6GHz wireless spectrum similar to the enviornment you will experience at competition. You can avoid interference from Bluetooth, 2.4GHz and 5GHz wi-fi devices, and overall have a much larger channel with more bandwidth allocated to your connection.

You need to be more careful mounting your radio to reap these benefits (imbedding the radio deep in your robot will likely lead to connectivity issues), but on the flipside the hope is you will have a cleaner connectivity experience when properly installed with fewer dropouts.

This comment does a pretty good job of clarifying things.

[FRC Blog] New Radios at 2024 FIRST Championship General Forum
I think the custom SSIDs are trying to fix this. From what I gathered from the radio documentation, the radio can be used in 2 modes: 6 GHz Client mode. The radio basically tries to connect to an access point, just like a laptop would. (I think this is how it connects to the FMS AP too) 2.4 GHz Access Point mode. The radio becomes it’s own access point, and everything connects to it. This means all the IP assignment is done by the radio, and everything in that network works together. The…
